docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: - The label text to associate with the toggle. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the toggle.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: track - The background track of the toggle.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: handle - The toggle handle, or knob, used to change the checked state.

props.name: alignment
props.docs:
How to control the alignment of the toggle and label on the cross axis.
``"start"`: The label and control will appear on the left of the cross axis in LTR, and on the right side in RTL.
`"center"`: The label and control will appear at the center of the cross axis in both LTR and RTL.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the toggle.

props.name: enableOnOffLabels
props.docs: Enables the on/off accessibility switch labels within the toggle.

props.name: justify
props.docs:
How to pack the label and toggle within a line.
`"start"`: The label and toggle will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and toggle will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and toggle will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

props.name: labelPlacement
props.docs:
Where to place the label relative to the input.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the toggle in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the toggle in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").
`"stacked"`: The label will appear above the toggle regardless of the direction. The alignment of the label can be controlled with the `alignment` property.

props.name: legacy
props.docs:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the default slot that contains
the label text. As a result, the `legacy` property should only be used as
an escape hatch when you want to avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: value
props.docs:
The value of the toggle does not mean if it's checked or not, use the `checked`
property for that.

The value of a toggle is analogous to the value of a `<input type="checkbox">`,
it's only used when the toggle participates in a native `<form>`.

events.docs: Emitted when the toggle loses focus.

Emitted when the user switches the toggle on or off. Does not emit
when programmatically changing the value of the `checked` property.
Emitted when the toggle has focus.

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the toggle track

styles.name: --handle-background-checked
styles.docs: Background of the toggle handle when checked

styles.name: --handle-border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the toggle handle

styles.name: --handle-box-shadow
styles.docs: Box shadow of the toggle handle

styles.name: --handle-max-height
styles.docs: Maximum height of the toggle handle

styles.name: --handle-spacing
styles.docs: Horizontal spacing around the toggle handle

styles.name: --track-background-checked
styles.docs: Background of the toggle track when checked

slots.docs: The label text to associate with the toggle. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the toggle.

parts.name: handle
parts.docs: The toggle handle, or knob, used to change the checked state.

parts.name: track
parts.docs: The background track of the toggle.
